metadata.dc:title: Anesthetic management of sacroiliac-vertebral echinococcosis
metadata.dc:description: Bone echinococcosis affects the spine and pelvis in60% of cases. Bone lesions may be silent for between 10and 20 years. The capsules progress aggressivelythrough the medullary canal and replace the trabecularbone without forming cysts, as occurs in the organs, thusmaking anaplylaxis rare. The combination ofchemotherapy and surgery facilitates anestheticmanagement and reduces the incidence of anaphylacticevents and disease recurrence (AU)
